perturbation.original_text: a.As of the VNBJ Closing, except as expressly set forth in this Amendment, the JV Agreement shall immediately cease to have any application or effect with respect to VNBJ, all rights and obligations with respect to VNBJ under the JV Agreement shall terminate and all references to "Company" or "Companies" in the JV Agreement (either in the body of the JV Agreement or its schedules and other attachments) shall read and be interpreted to mean VNBZ and/or ANRA except as the context otherwise requires.
perturbation.changed_text: a.As of the VNBJ Closing, the JV Agreement shall immediately cease to have any application or effect with respect to VNBJ, all rights and obligations with respect to VNBJ under the JV Agreement shall terminate and all references to "Company" or "Companies" in the JV Agreement (either in the body of the JV Agreement or its schedules and other attachments) shall read and be interpreted to mean VNBZ and/or ANRA except as the context otherwise requires. However, the JV Agreement may still apply to VNBJ at the discretion of the Nissin Parties.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the JV Agreement ceases to have any application to VNBJ, but the addition grants discretion to the Nissin Parties to still apply the agreement. This creates uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: d.Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the termination of the JV Agreement with respect to VNBJ, VNBZ or the Veoneer Parties shall not release any Veoneer Party or any Nissin Party from liability for the breach of any of its representations, warranties, covenants or agreements set forth in the JV Agreement that arise prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.changed_text: d.Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the termination of the JV Agreement with respect to VNBJ, VNBZ or the Veoneer Parties shall not release any Veoneer Party or any Nissin Party from liability for the breach of any of its representations, warranties, covenants or agreements set forth in the JV Agreement that arise prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable. However, the release from liability is subject to the sole discretion of the governing court.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause clearly states that termination does not release parties from prior liabilities. The added clause that this is 'subject to the sole discretion of the governing court' directly contradicts this. It introduces ambiguity as to whether parties remain liable for prior breaches post-termination.

perturbation.original_text: This Amendment shall only become effective upon the VNBJ Closing with respect to Article 1.1 and the VNBZ Closing with respect to Article 1.2, and shall terminate without any force or effect in the event that the VNBJ SPA and the VNBZ SPA are terminated in accordance with the terms thereof.
perturbation.changed_text: This Amendment shall only become effective upon the VNBJ Closing with respect to Article 1.1 and the VNBZ Closing with respect to Article 1.2, and shall terminate without any force or effect in the event that the VNBJ SPA and the VNBZ SPA are terminated in accordance with the terms thereof. However, the amendment will remain in effect indefinitely if Honda approves the agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text indicates a clear condition for the amendment's termination: if the share purchase agreements are terminated. The addition contradicts this by stating the amendment remains effective if Honda approves, creating uncertainty about the termination condition.
